text: وجعل القمر فيهن نورا وجعل الشمس سراجا

translations.translation: And has placed the moon therein, an illumination, and has placed the sun, a lighted lamp?
and has placed the moon in them as a light, and the sun as a radiant lamp?
and placed therein the moon as a light
‘And in them, has illuminated the moon, and made the sun a lamp?’
And has made the moon a light therein, and made the sun a lamp
And made the moon therein a light, and made the sun a lamp?
and set the moon therein for a light and the sun for a lamp?
And hath made the moon a light therein, and made the sun a lamp?
and made the moon therein a light, and made the sun a lamp,
And hath placed the moon therein for a light, and hath made the sun a lamp?
and has made therein the moon for a light and the sun for a lamp?
And made the moon a light in their midst, and made the sun as a (Glorious) Lamp?
And has made the moon a light therein, and made the sun a lamp?
setting in them the moon as a light and the sun as a lantern?
And He set the moon in their midst for light, and He made the sun a lamp.
And made the moon therein a [reflected] light and made the sun a burning lamp?

[71:16] and made the moon therein — that is to say, within their totality, [but] which is [effectively] true in the case of the heaven of this world — as a light and made the sun as a lamp?, as an illuminating lantern, more powerful than the light of the moon.
(And hath made the moon) along with them (a light therein) a shining light therein, (and made the sun a lamp) a radiance for the children of Adam?

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { وَجَعَلَ ٱلْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ } أي: في السماوات { نُوراً } مقتبساً من شمس الذات { وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمْسَ } المشرقة المنيرة { سِرَاجاً } [نوح: 16] واضحاً، ودليلاً لائحاً على شروق شمس الذات على مظاهر عموم الذرات المنعكسة منها

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text: { وجعل الشمسَ سِراجاً } مصباحاً يزيل ظلمة الليل، ويُبصر أهلُ الدنيا في ضوئها وجه الأرض، ويُشاهدون الآفاق، كما يُبصر أهل البيت في ضوء السراج ما يحتاجون إلى إبصاره، وليس القمر بهذه المثابة، إنما هو نور في الجملة، فنور الشمس أقوى، ومنه يستمد نور القمر، وأجمعوا أنَّ الشمس في السماء الرابعة
